title: 'Valley Drug' logo from the Hypnocil bottle in Nightmare On Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors
author: ElmStWriter

comments.content:
I'd truly be grateful for some type of help in finding this font...  
I'm trying to recreate Nancy's Hypnocil bottle from NOES 3 and I would like to get the drug store logo as accurate as possible.  
Thank you!

It might be lettering, at least I have not seen a matching font. So far, I have found four candidates that are roughly a match for the letters, without the extensions.  
If you can edit fonts you could use any of them to make a reasonable imitation.  
Sneaker Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/sneaker-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319225847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/sneaker-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/sneaker-script/")  
Monoline Script MT [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monoline-script-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319225847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monoline-script-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/monoline-script-mt/")  
Swing [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/swing-2/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319225847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/swing-2/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/swing-2/")  
Tribeca Script [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tribeca-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140319225847/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tribeca-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pelavin/tribeca-script/")  
Don
